Package me.steep.steepapi.api

Class BattalionAPI

java.lang.Object
me.steep.steepapi.api.BattalionAPI
public class BattalionAPI extends Object
Never assign a new BattalionAPI(), just get it via SteepAPI.getBattalionAPI()

    • getEShieldedPlayers

      public Set<UUID> getEShieldedPlayers()
      I loop through this every 2 seconds (if at least 1 player is using an EShield) for the EShield health indicator actionbar
      Returns:
      A Set of UUID's containing the UUID's of all players that are currently using an EShield

      @NotNull public @NotNull Set<String> getBattalionItemTypes​(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Please make sure to use isBattalionItem(ItemStack) before this, or you WILL get errors
      Returns:
      A list of strings (these strings each represent a BattalionItemType.toString())

      public String getProgressBar​(double min, double max, int bars, String color)
      Parameters:
      min - The amount left of the max value
      max - The max progress value
      bars - The amount of bars this progressbar should have
      color - The color of the progress
      Returns:
      The requested progressbar as a String

    • displayProgressBar

      public void displayProgressBar()
      Starts the actionbar runnable (only if inactive) that displays both the actionbar for EnergyShields and EnergySabers to all relevant players (stops if nobody has an EnergyShield or EnergySaber active)
